body: Thanks for the PR. Sorry for not getting to this sooner. The issue that the PR tries to solve was resolved via https://github.com/apache/kafka/commit/c4bbf342432291220242ad4177fd72a959ddcb94 so feel free to close this PR (we can't do it ourselves).
Thanks, left a couple of minor comments. Looks good otherwise.
This seems a little more involved than a hotfix, so I'm going to reopen under KAFKA-3674.
Ping @Ishiihara and @ewencp for review.
@junrao I expanded the test to include the preferred replica case and also where a shutting down broker dies.
The PR does what the JIRA says, but I'm not particularly familiar with the Streams windowing code. So probably good to get a +1 from @enothereska as well.

I had to start another system tests run as 435 hung:

https://jenkins.confluent.io/job/system-test-kafka-branch-builder/437/

There were two failures:
- test_id:    2016-05-07--002.kafkatest.tests.core.replication_test.ReplicationTest.test_replication_with_broker_failure.security_protocol=PLAINTEXT.failure_mode=hard_bounce.broker_type=controller
- test_id:    2016-05-07--002.kafkatest.tests.connect.connect_rest_test.ConnectRestApiTest.test_rest_api

Both are known to be transient. All the other replication test variants passed and there's a PR for the connect transient failures: https://github.com/apache/kafka/pull/1340

So, merging to trunk and 0.10.
Thanks for your contribution!
@hachikuji Found one possible issue (which is really an additional bug but maybe worth addressing here), but otherwise this looks good.

System tests run:
https://jenkins.confluent.io/job/system-test-kafka-branch-builder-2/65/console

Two failures: known to be transient offset validation and connect rest tests.

All `test_upgrade` variants passed (including the lz4 ones).

Review by @ewencp or @gwenshap.
Thanks for all the feedback, I'll update the PR accordingly
Thanks for the patch. LGTM
Done with the update. Thanks for your feedback.
@ewencp Good catch again. I've updated the patch to handle that case too.
Thanks, LGTM. Merged to trunk and 0.10.0 branches.
We also have https://cwiki.apache.org/confluence/display/KAFKA/Kafka+data+structures+in+Zookeeper, @gwenshap which of the two copies do we want to maintain going forward? The one in the Git repo?
@gwenshap Are we ready to start linking to the website for the protocol docs or is the wiki page still better? The wiki page links to the website, but mentions that it's still in-progress.
@arunmahadevan, because our test coverage for these tools is not good, we need to manually test changes like this. Can you please describe the steps to reproduce the NPE?
Thanks for the PR @dpkp. Would it be possible to add a test for this?

@ewencp Ready for another look. I've modified the config backing store to ensure that we always have a valid target state for each connector. If we receive an unexpected deletion, then the state is reverted to STARTED which is consistent with how we treat the initial absence of a target state when migrating from an older cluster.
@ewencp Addressed review comments. PTAL.
@ewencp Thanks for the review. PTAL.
@ewencp @granders Minor change to system test README.md
@ewencp Minor change to connect standalone. Thanks!
LGTM
@junrao @SinghAsDev - Let me know if anything else is required to get this in?
@gwenshap @SinghAsDev - Let me know if any more changes are required.
LGTM, w/ relevant system test passing here: https://jenkins.confluent.io/job/system-test-kafka-branch-builder/439/console
LGTM
@hachikuji This LGTM for the issues raised in the JIRA. Let's just file a follow up for that last issue I identified wrt multiple updates on the same connector where the last one is a deletion.
LGTM
Thanks for the PR, seems like conflicts need to be resolved.
One small comment regarding consistent terminology, otherwise LGTM.
A minor comment, LGTM otherwise. Thanks for the fix!
cc @rajinisivaram

One issue is that this is not considered public API, so encouraging users to override it seems like a bad idea. Since `evaluateResponse` is based on a standard, it seems pretty safe for this code to be duplicated in users that want to implement their own `PlainSaslServer`. In the future, one could make the authentication part pluggable, if there's enough interest (would require a KIP).

@ijuma @edoardocomar It is a simple change and I understand the motivation for the change. But I agree with @ijuma that `PlainSaslServer` is an internal implementation class and shouldn't really be extended. It could in theory be changed at any time, breaking subclasses which rely on it.
@dpkp I created a PR (https://github.com/dpkp/kafka/pull/2) with a test and the exception changes I suggested. Can you please review and integrate if you agree?
The next RC is meant to go out this morning, so we need to get this merged ASAP.
LGTM, merged to trunk and 0.10.0.

Thanks for the patch. LGTM. Just a few minor comments.

@ijuma : You can merge this if you are satisfied.
Thanks for the PR, LGTM.
@mimaison, will you be able to make the changes requested by @junrao soon?
@ijuma just pushed a new commit that does it
LGTM.
OK, great. Will run the tests and merge it to trunk and 0.10.0 if they pass.
Merged to trunk and 0.10.0.
@SinghAsDev @ijuma @granthenke I updated this pull request based on the feedback received. Would appreciate your input again.
@junrao Would appreciate your input on this pull request.

@mimaison @edoardocomar Thanks for the PR and for responding to feedback promptly. And thanks to @alekar and @Ishiihara for the other PRs whose ideas and code were integrated into this PR. And finally  thanks to @junrao and @guozhangwang for reviews.

Merged to trunk and 0.10.0 as the tests passed.
@becketqin Do you mind taking a look at this pull request when possible? I believe you had opened the JIRA a while back. Thanks.
Sorry, offline last night / this a.m. I merged in your changes, @ijuma . Thanks!!

LGTM.

Thanks @dpkp for catching this in the first place and for merging the PR. Gwen reviewed by PR, so I'll go ahead and merge this as soon as the tests pass.
@ijuma Sorry I had missed your note. I have rebased the PR.
@ijuma @gwenshap Trivial doc additions, should be double committed.
Thanks for the PR, LGTM.
LGTM
@ijuma - Lets roll protocol to the site immediately after 0.10.0 release? Since some of our new protocols were added just to the generated docs.

ah, this is inside the docs themselves (not the top-level site link).
Yeah, lets roll it in.
Sounds good.
LGTM, merged to trunk.
LGTM
LGTM too.
@benstopford Do you mean extending the test to include PLAIN to GSSAPI as well? Or more mechanisms than the two we currently have?
Merged to trunk and the 0.10.0 branch.
Review by @gwenshap.
@ewencp PTAL. Thanks!
LGTM, and tests are passing [here](https://jenkins.confluent.io/job/system-test-kafka-branch-builder/440/console)

@Ishiihara One more minimal change to avoid potential conflicts/errors, but this LGTM. We pay a very slight penalty since we now recreate the `ConfigDef` every time we use the base `ConnectorConfig`'s `ConfigDef`, but that is an insignificant cost.
@ewencp Thanks for the review. Made the corresponding change.

Obviously the one in Git :)
Our structure docs should be versioned with the releases.

Any chance we could auto-generate those too? Maybe @vahidhashemian can do a follow-on? Or @granthenke, since he auto-generated the protocol?
Not sure what is involved in auto-generate. If @granthenke sends me some pointers I can give it a try :)
This depends on https://github.com/apache/kafka/pull/1356
For now, @vahidhashemian, can you just open a JIRA? Just so we won't lose track of the requirement?
LGTM, and I've manually validated that source and sink configs return the right set of configs and do so consistently (i.e. we don't see any "contamination" due to shared static variables).
@gwenshap Sure, will do shortly.
@ewencp Ready for another round of review. Thanks!
LGTM. Thanks for contributing @QwertyManiac and for reviewing @SinghAsDev.

Ick! Looks like we have a conflict.

Can you guys rebase?

Thank you for working on this very important issue @bendrees.

This is a placeholder for me to take a look immediately after I'm done chasing down 0.10.0 blockers and docs :)

Since this adds a new configuration, I think we need a KIP (Kafka Improvement Proposal) to discuss the proposed change. You can read about KIPs here: https://cwiki.apache.org/confluence/display/KAFKA/Kafka+Improvement+Proposals

Let me know if you need help drafting a proposal.
@ijuma Could you take a look?
@hachikuji This looks great to me, but do you want to ping someone not working directly on Connect for review? Docs are often best reviewed by a newbie user.
LGTM
Thanks for the PR. I left one comment, looks good otherwise (it also needs to be rebased as Gwen said).

@ijuma thanks for your reviews. learning lot from your reviews.

Pl review latest update
Review by @ewencp.
@Ishiihara Also, I kicked off a test run here https://jenkins.confluent.io/job/system-test-kafka-branch-builder/441/console but some of the tests are failing.

@Ishiihara This is a simple correctness fix, so maybe just prefix with MINOR, although it might be good to know how it is reproduced (which might need a JIRA). Also, this probably should have been caught by unit tests, so this should probably be accompanied by a change to `SchemaBuilderTest`.

Also, understanding when this is triggered will help figure out the severity. Is this a blocker for 0.10.0.0? Simply inconvenient?

@ewencp This may depends on the JDK version. For reference see: http://www-01.ibm.com/support/docview.wss?uid=swg1PK15744. In some JDK versions, `UnmodifiedMap` will throw `NullPointerException` if `null` is passed to the constructor.

I think it is pretty severe for some JDK versions as it is not possible to create connectors at all. I will file a JIRA as a 0.10.0 blocker.

@ewencp @ijuma @miguno @hachikuji  It seems good to return `null` for `parameters` method. We can have a follow up discussion on the changes to `SchemaBuilder`. Let me know if there is anything that I missed.

I can be your newbie. :)  What's the relationship between a connector's state and the state of all it's tasks?  For example, if a connector is paused, must all it's tasks be paused?  In other words, is a connector's state derived from the state of it's tasks or is it independent?

Other than that, it looks great!
I'm the other newbie (at @hachikuji's request). LGTM. Good question from @theduderog.
@guozhangwang Looking at this PR, it also shows that we are not closing the metrics and we should.

@becketqin @hachikuji I tried to follow @becketqin's design to implement this PR. A quick test on my side shows that the offsets are being committed now. Would love to have your feedback as I may have missed something here.

Good catch @ijuma
I guess this should be a separate issue though? Or do you want to fix it in this PR? If yes, `StreamThread.close()` should be extended to call `metrics.close()` (the class need a private member to reference the `Metrics` object, too)

As there is no JIRA for this PR, I am wondering if `KafkaStreams` should expose metrics? What is the purpose? @jklukas can you please clarify.

@mjsax Yes, it should be done separately. I was just raising the issue so that one of the Streams contributors/committers would pick it up. :)

I agree that it would be good to have a JIRA for this PR as we are exposing a new method in a public class.
It would be good to explain the purpose of doing this.

@ijuma @ewencp @granders @hachikuji Please review this.  We did a check whether `CLASSPATH` is defined or empty to determine whether we should include that. When doing that check, we should make sure that spaces in the external  `CLASSPATH` do not mess the check.  This causes issues in some murkrake tests.
Thanks @Ishiihara. Are they needed everywhere or just in conditions?
